p: With the name “ chai makkeh” H. sabdariffa flowers are used in the treatment of diabetes, hypertension, cardiovascular diseases and stress in Iranian traditional medicine ( Amiri and Joharchi, 2013). In Thessalonica are used to treat diabetes, constipation, dyspepsia, cholesterol, obesity, and a hair tonic, depurative and stimulant ( Hanlidou et al., 2004). In Hatay Province (Turkey) the decoction of sepals is used for cold and flu ( Güzel et al., 2015).
